title: Global search results in Service Portal and Agent Interface differ
content:
When using the same keyword for a global search in both the Service Portal and Agent Interface, the Service Portal is able to return results, but the Agent Interface sometimes fails to do so.

Cause

The Service Portal includes the parameter DetectLanguageType=true in the payload sent to IDOL, while the Agent Interface does not.

Solution

Add a tenant setting called ESS_BACKUP_FLAG4 to control whether the Agent Interface includes the DetectLanguageType=true parameter.

By default, ESS_BACKUP_FLAG4 is false, indicating that the parameter is not included. To include it in the Agent Interface, set the value of ESS_BACKUP_FLAG4 to true as follows:

  1. Open a REST client such as Postman.

  2. Send the following Post request to get the SMAX token.

    • URL (replace <hostname> and <tenantId> below with the real hostname and tenantID)

      https://<hostname>/auth/authentication-endpoint/authenticate/token?tenantId=<tenantId>

    • Body (replace suite-admin with the tenant admin login name and replace password_for_admin with the login password)

      {"login":"suite-admin","password":"password_for_admin"}

  3. Take note of the token value in the response body.

  4. Send the following PUT request to set the value of ESS_BACKUP_FLAG4.

    • URL (replace <hostname> and <tenantId> below with the real hostname and tenantID)

      https://<hostname>/rest/<tenantId>/common-settings/setting/ESS_BACKUP_FLAG4

    • Header (replace token with the value obtained from Step 3)

      Cookie: LWSSO_COOKIE_KEY=token

    • Body

      {"value":true}
      If you find "1" in the response body, then the value of ESS_BACKUP_FLAG4 is set to true.
  5. (Optional) To verify the value of ESS_BACKUP_FLAG4, follow the Step 4 but send a GET request instead of a PUT request.
